author: JTRocknRossi Community Member
title: Re: Night Vision
text:
3 weeks ago
I have a new 2nd Gen indoor wired Nest Camera, however, it does not come out of night vision mode. I have reset that device, cleaned the lens, and Google support even replaced the device a few weeks ago, however, the problems persist, each day I have to go into the Home app and toggle Night Vision mode from Auto to off and then back to Auto, if I leave the setting to off, it become grainy and unfocused. The room is very dark with the blinds closed and I would think as soon as I open those blind and the light comes in that night vision would turn itself off, but it is not doing that... Are there any newer firmware REV's available? Please advise
2 weeks ago
***Important update to this Post*** After going home last night and thinking more about the location of this camera, high in the corner of the room (the dark corner that does not get direct light from the window) I started to turn on / off the over head light and once that light was turned on with the window blinds open, I could hear a clicking toggling itself (night vision lights coming off and on) with the switching of the overhead lights off and on. So while night vision works in extreme lighted and no lighted environments, it must be the dark corner and the ambient light sensor not detecting enough light or darkness to make this work as designed. I would move the camera but it is the only logical place to put it to see what needs to be seen. Google Please advise.. thanks JTRnR
2 weeks ago
At this point I have not received any help regarding Night Vision, the problems persist, sometimes I work around it by toggling the Night Vision setting from Auto to Off and back to Auto and the the Night Vision goes off in a 1 window room, meaning it a bit dark in the corner where the camera is, but the the view shows light in the room. And BTW the contrast on this new Gen 2 Nest Wired Camera is too bright.. Anyway to adjust that?
2 weeks ago
Hi there!
Thanks for posting here in the community. I'm sorry the Night Vision mode doesn't come out. Help's here!
I'd like to ask a question:
Let's try the following:
Keep me posted.
Best regards,
Melany
2 weeks ago
I don't mind sharing a photo of the rooms and lighting, but don't have permissions in this forum to upload, it reported that error when I tried. Regardless, I move the new 2nd Gen Camera into a very well lite room (Entryway) downstairs and still the camara stays in night vision mode as of 7:30am this morning, Sunrise was 6:54am all curtains in the rooms were open, no direct sunlight, just a problem 2nd Gen camera with faulty firmware still in black and white night vision mode.. I trust this will be investigated and fixed in the months to come I hope... this device has already been reset, replaced and moved around our home to demonstrate that the sensor that controls this is not set or working properly.
2 weeks ago
By 8:30 AM the "Entryway Camera" did come out of night vision mode, that is the new Gen 2 Wired camera, so it works, just not as expected. And the 1st gen camera that was working great in this entryway before I moved the 2nd gen downstairs is upstairs now in the spare bedroom and office is still in night vision mode, this is a one window room and both camera and the light face the same way, meaning the are side by side facing the same direction, and now this camera does not come out of night vision mode, so in the end I would say that these cameras night vision does work, but not at expected. I will be on the look out for some sort of firmware rev on the Gen 2 camera in the future.. "that all I got to say about that!" mic drop... I am out!
2 weeks ago
Hi
[@JTRocknRossi](/t5/user/viewprofilepage/user-id/46243),
Thanks for the information.
My team would like to learn more about this behavior. When you get a chance, please fill out
this form and let me know when you’re finished. We’ll have someone reach out to you via email from there.
To help us assist you better, please include the link to your Community thread and your Community username.
Let me know if you have any other questions.
Regards,
Melany
a week ago
Hi there!
We received your form. I appreciate you taking the time to fill it out. Our team will reach out to you via email to further assist you.
Let me know if you have any other questions.
Best regards,
Melany
a week ago
The new Nest Gen 2 camera was moved out of a 1 windows dark cornered room, and into the main living space and now it does go in and out of Night Vision mode with out user intervention. However, the gen 1 Camera that was moved into that room now does the same thing in that corner, this legitimately does not not look like an issue other than that ambient light sensor might need some tweaking. No other action is needed on my part, the Nest/Google Home network is awesome and works as designed.
a week ago
Hi there!
We appreciate the information you have provided. We are glad to know that your Nest cameras are working correctly.
Please do not hesitate to contact us if you need assistance.
Best regards,
Melany
39m ago
Jumping through all the google "Hoops" or suggestions work temporarily, there is a much bigger problem here that google needs to address by updating, fixing, changing the behavior of the IR night vision mode sensor, it is just stuck in night vision mode, its been fully light for that last hour, blinds are all open in our main living area and BLAM still stuck in night vision mode, and yes I can toggle the setting off and back on and it comes out but this is not a solution, just a small band-aid and honestly I am very disappointed that Google has not come out with some kind of Firmware REV or permanent Fix, this is the last time I buy something just released and new from your company. That explains why everyone single one of these Nest next gen 2 wired indoor camera's were on sales for as low as $69 in some places. Very disappointed customer! BTW the camera after writing this did come out of Night vision mode but it took an 90 minutes after I opened up all the blinds and it was past 8 AM in the morning

author: For The Weekly News
title: Republic employees reaffirm decision to strike - NewsBreak
text:
peabodyweeklynews.com
website
Phoenix
Republic employees reaffirm decision to strike
By For The Weekly News,
1 days agoAt a meeting Sunday, Aug. 3, Republic employees voted to continue their five-week strike by a vote of 93% to stay on strike. Tom Mari, president of Teamsters Local Union No. 25, explained the process thus far in negotiations and went over the open issues including wages, health insurance and lack of amnesty.

author: Sofía Serelli
title: Un ministro salteño se hizo viral por sus extrañas expresiones y salió a justificarse pero siguen las dudas (VIDEO)
text: En las últimas horas se hizo viral un controversial video protagonizado por el ministro de Turismo y Deportes de Salta, Mario Pena, en el que es visto realizando gestos frenéticos y mirando intranquilamente a su alrededor. Por el revuelo, el funcionario se vio obligado a explicar que detrás de las imágenes hay “una edición”, pero los internautas aún teorizan sobre lo ocurrido. Las redes sociales no descansan y mucho menos cuando se trata de temas relativos a la política. Es que, los debates y críticas más acaloradas se suceden en “la calle online”, donde la libertad de expresión y las opiniones sobre determinados hechos abundan. Ahora, quien se convirtió en el tema principal de muchos usuarios de Instagram y TikTok fue el ministro salteño Mario Pena, quien generó serias dudas y preocupación en un video viral. Es que, durante la presentación de la quinta edición de la Semana Gastronómica, el titular de Turismo fue captado con la mirada desorbitada, los ojos muy abiertos y movimientos incesantes en una sala de conferencia. A raíz de estas imágenes, algunas personas manifestaron que este accionar podría deberse al consumo de estupefacientes. Otros consideraron que Peña podía estar atravesando alguna enfermedad. No obstante, estas dudas fueron saldadas por el propio ministro. Algunas de ellas, al menos. En diálogo con el medio Datasa Salta, Peña dijo que “de alguna forma, hay una edición sobre una situación que estaba pasando en la sala” de reuniones de Turismo. “Yo miraba mucho para arriba. Para quien no conoce el lugar, en la sala de conferencia donde estábamos, hay un cañón (de luz) en el techo y veía que se estaba cayendo. Dije ‘¡no vaya a ser que se le caiga a uno de los periodistas!’”, siguió. En este marco, el funcionario explicó que su dispersión se debía a que esta situación no pasara a mayores, por lo que también miraba a los presentes para ver “si alguien se estaba dando cuenta”. “Hay una edición en el tema de la velocidad, de la repetición, se me agrandan los ojos, aduce a algo muy personal. Son los gajes del oficio, lamentablemente. Lo único que uno puede hacer es dar explicaciones a la familia. Hoy se viraliza todo así”, concluyó el ministro.

author: Ghana News
title: Low Maintenance Hairstyles Ladies Can Make to Look Beautiful
text:
In today’s fast-paced world, many women seek hairstyles that require minimal effort yet still exude elegance and charm. Low-maintenance hairstyles are not only practical but can also be incredibly chic, allowing ladies to feel beautiful without spending hours in front of the mirror. Here’s a look at some stunning options that help you look fabulous with little upkeep.
Firstly on the list is the classic messy bun. This effortlessly stylish look is perfect for both casual outings and professional settings. Simply gather your hair at the crown of your head, twist it into a bun, and secure it with a hair tie. A few loose strands can frame your face beautifully, adding a touch of softness. This style works well with all hair types and can be dressed up with accessories like hairpins or a headband.
Another fantastic option is the low ponytail. This hairstyle is not only easy to achieve but also gives off an air of sophistication. To create a low ponytail, gather your hair at the nape of your neck and secure it. For added flair, wrap a section of hair around the hair tie to conceal it, securing it with a bobby pin. This look is perfect for both work and social events, making it a versatile choice.
For those with medium to long hair, consider the wavy lob. This shoulder-length haircut can be left to air dry for a natural, beachy wave look. To enhance the waves, a simple texturizing spray can be applied, adding volume and definition. The lob is flattering on various face shapes and requires minimal styling, making it a favorite among busy women.
If you prefer a more polished look, the straight and sleek bob is an excellent choice. This hairstyle is effortlessly chic and can be easily maintained with regular trims. A flat iron can be used to achieve the smooth finish, and a shine serum can add a touch of glamour. This bob can be worn with or without bangs, depending on your preference.
Lastly, braids offer a stylish solution with low maintenance. Options like the side braid or fishtail braid can be done in a matter of minutes. They not only keep hair secure but also add a touch of whimsy and flair.

author: Redação Brasil 247
title: Polícia prende 3 suspeitos de envolvimento em atentado contra comício de petista no RS | Brasil 247
text: [HOME](/)> [Sul](/regionais/sul) Polícia prende 3 suspeitos de envolvimento em atentado contra comício de petista no RS A operação teve como objetivo desarticular uma associação criminosa que supostamente tentava “interferir ilegalmente no processo eleitoral” 247 – Uma operação conjunta da Polícia Federal (PF) e da Polícia Civil do Rio Grande do Sul (PC-RS) prendeu nesta quinta-feira (26) três suspeitos de envolvimento em um ataque a tiros contra comício do candidato petista à prefeitura de Bagé, Luiz Fernando Mainardi, ocorrido em 15 de setembro. Embora seis tiros tenham sido disparados, ninguém ficou ferido, e o agressor conseguiu fugir. Conforme relatado pela [CartaCapital](https://www.cartacapital.com.br/politica/policia-prende-3-acusados-de-envolvimento-em-ataque-a-tiros-contra-comicio-de-petista-no-rs/), o suposto autor dos tiros foi encontrado morto no último dia 24, na cidade de Itaara, a 250 quilômetros de Bagé. A Polícia Federal investiga o caso como uma possível queima de arquivo. A operação desta quinta-feira teve como objetivo desarticular uma associação criminosa que supostamente tentava “interferir ilegalmente no processo eleitoral”. “Durante as investigações, identificou-se que uma facção criminosa, dedicada ao tráfico de drogas e a outros delitos, estaria apoiando a campanha de determinada candidata, através do angariamento de votos, da cessão de imóveis para colocação de artigos de campanha, de atividades de segurança, entre outras formas de colaboração”, apontou a PF. Conforme apontou as investigações, o grupo criminoso atuava ainda para intimidar candidatos adversários e eleitores. Além dos mandados de prisão, foram cumpridos 17 mandados de busca e apreensão nas cidades de Bagé e em Santa Maria, além de uma penitenciária de segurança máxima em Charqueadas. [iBest: 247 é o melhor canal de política do Brasil no voto popular](https://www.brasil247.com/midia/brasil-247-vence-o-premio-ibest-como-melhor-canal-de-politica-do-brasil-no-voto-popular) [Assine o 247](https://www.brasil247.com/apoio),[ apoie por Pix](https://docs.google.com/forms/d/e/1FAIpQLSfJOi0sp8RTiS91kHjo4uzLo97gMTG2ieIk-OOsdv7cvCgFnw/viewform),[ inscreva-se na TV 247](https://www.youtube.com/brasil247), no canal [Cortes 247](https://www.youtube.com/channel/UC_M1ek8fhnDkz5C2zfkTxpg) e assista:

author: Ysinembargosemueve
title: #54 Los salarios y las pensiones pueden retrasarse en Ucrania sin la ayuda occidental: El Consejo de Ministros fija un plazo [ENG]
text:
Portada
mis comunidades
otras secciones
[#7](c7#c-7) Claro y Rusia es el paraíso comunista definitivo. Sin corrupción, con todos los derechos y todas la necesidades de su población cubiertas . No entiendo por que los Ucronazis rechazan el gran regalo que les hace Putin de unirse a ellos, que se rindan de una vez.
Si la corrupción fuera un impedimento para recibir ayuda no podríamos ayudar a nadie.
Te recuerdo que muchos en la Troika decían cosas similares a lo que comentas en
[#2](c2#c-2) de los P.I.E.G no hace tanto, solo que en vez de a morir era a vagear y no Ucrania no es el país mas corrupto de Europa es Rusia.
[#6](c6#c-6) es igual que Ucrania sea el primero, el segundo o el cuarto, lo importante es que es un país muy corrupto y desde la UE lo regamos con mucho dinero que mejor usábamos para otras cosas.
[#20](c20#c-20) a donde vas?, manzanas traigo, y no, esta guerra empezo antes, en 1994 con una abuelita regalando madalenas mientras decidia quien seria el proximo presidente de Ucrania
[#28](c28#c-28) Que un parlamento no respete lo que pone en la constitución para destituir al presidente y nombrar sucesor, ¿qué es?
[#31](c31#c-31) El 111, que establecía el procedimiento del impeachment. La mayoría para el impeachment era el 3/4 de la cámara, cosa que no se cumplió, votó a favor el 73%.
El 112, que establecía que ante la terminación prematura, el sucesor sería el primer ministro.
Esas dos, así, a botepronto. Sin meterme en cómo fue el impeachment, donde no se respeto el procedimiento establecido.
[#32](c32#c-32) ¿Dónde aparecen los 3/4?
https://rm.coe.int/constitution-of-ukraine/168071f58b
Y el primer ministro había dimitido.
[#33](c33#c-33) Había un Primer Ministro el 22 de febrero de 2014: Serhiy Arbuzov. Pero, se inventaron sucesor colocando a Turchinov, presidente de la Rada.
Y lo pone en la versión de 2010, vigente en 2014.
https://en.m.wikisource.org/wiki/Constitution_of_Ukraine,_2010
Artículos 111 y 112.
[#42](c42#c-42) Después del 22 de febrero. No antes. La vigente cuando se destitiyó a Yanukovich era la de 2010.
[#44](c44#c-44) Es verdad, el cambio por urgencia, sin seguir el procedimiento.
Como decía Dimitri Pitterman, "todo legal".
[#46](c46#c-46) Bueno, otros, el 155 (qué casualidad) y el 156, que plantean un referendum a la ciudadanía para modificar la constitución.
La modificiacióm se tramitó de prisa y corriendo, para implementar los acuerdos de Minsk, y de cara a relajar la tensión, que ya se vió cómo terminó.
Que Yanukovich era corrupto lo sabemos todos. Que sin Nuland y cía repartiendo dinero a espuertas no hubiera caído también. Y que en ese punto, un articulito de nada de la constitución importaba a todos un pito, también.
Pero aun así, se destituyó a Yanukovich, no se nombró sucesor al Primer Ministro, y voila, Ukrania tuvo un gobierno prooccidental, cuando había votado a uno prorruso.
Pero, volviendo a Piterman (ukraniano él), "todo legal".
[#47](c47#c-47) Una vez más, el primer ministro había renunciado. Y Yanukovich puso en marcha un plan de acercamiento a la UE para facilitar el acuerdo comercial entre ambos. No hacía falta ninguna conspiración para tener un gobierno pro occidental en Ucrania. A lo mejor no habría perdido el apoyo de su partido y el resto del parlamento si no hubiese roto las negociaciones sin motivo aparente.
[#48](c48#c-48) Tras la renuncia de Azarov estaba Arbuzov, antes que Yatsenyuk.
Por cierto, Yatsenyuk, el que salía en los audios de Nuland con el embajador yanki. Esas del "fuck the EU".
[#50](c50#c-50) Que sí, que todos destituídos y casualmente le tocó el turno al que nombraba Nuland como posible candidato.
Y que todo legal.
[#52](c52#c-52) Ya te he dicho el art 155 y 156, que establecen un referendum para el cambio constitucional, que se lo pasaron por el forro, porque había interés oolítico en hacer como que se implementaban los acuerdos de Minsk.
Sin referendum se aprueba una modificación constitucional, se quita a Yanukovich, a Arbuzov, al que haga falta y ponen a Yatsenyuk.
[#1](c1#c-1) Hungría lleva tiempo escorada al bando ruso, así que su posición es obvia. Pero tampoco olvidaría que la ayuda de la UE sale del precupuesto y se están haciendo recortes que no caen demasiado bien a algunos colectivos afectados.
[#1](c1#c-1) Occidente sabe perfectamente que Rusia los ha humillado ante el resto del planeta y que por más pasta que metan en Ucrania no van a poder girar el resultado, de ahí que empiecen las curvas financieras.
Por otro lado, a Zelensky le quedan tres telediarios, así que la cuestión ahora mismo es si pondrán otro pelele e intentarán acabar de picar hasta el último ucraniano para alargar el conflicto, si saldremos por la puerta de atrás o si motivaremos una guerra civil para dejar el país en la más absoluta mierda.
Lo que está totalmente claro es que la guerra contra Rusia está completamente perdida y que Ucrania ronda el millón de bajas entre fallecidos y desaparecidos. El resto depende en gran medida de los locos al otro lado del charco y de su afán por seguir estampándose contra el muro de realidad en el que están perdiendo su hegemonía.
Resumen de comentarios de este envío: zazis de MNM en contra del programa de Préstamo y Arriendo de la Segunda Guerra Mundial. "¿Por qué vamos a sostener a un régimen corrupto, criminal y asesino como el de Stalin?", se preguntan.
Ya lo dije el otro día:
Dinero y artillería. Un análisis de los flujos necesarios para sostener a Ucrania
Falta artillería y ahora ya se habla de que falta dinero.
Buenas noches,
¿Porque la ultraderecha? Hay formaciones de izquierdas como Podemos en España que están a favor de terminar la guerra.
Ucrania ha tenido gobiernos de todos los colores en los últimos 15 años. En Rusia un único candidato efectivo. Y los líderes de la oposición acaban en la cárcel, envenenados o saltan de un balcón.
No es el único indicativo de corrupción en un país, pero para mí es uno de los más significativos y fácil de ver.

author: world today news
title: Microsoft improves support for passkeys in Windows 11
text:
Microsoft is significantly improving its support for passkeys within Windows 11 soon, as the new Windows Hello experience will let you choose the way you want to save user folders, and even sync with a Microsoft account or store them through 1Password, Bitwarden, or other package providers.
A password manager API and a new third-party package mean developers can connect directly to Windows 11. The same passkey from a mobile phone can also be used to authenticate on a PC.
Microsoft is also rapidly redesigning the Windows Hello, including the ability to set up sync codes to your Microsoft account or save them elsewhere.
Once you’re set up for the first time, you can use your face, fingerprint, or PIN to authenticate with a passkey across multiple Windows 11 devices.
Nearby properties
Windows Insiders will be able to access these new passkey features first in the coming months, and it will take some time until all Windows 11 users will be able to experience these new packages .
Microsoft plans to share more details about its improved support for passkeys during Windows security sessions at the Authenticate 2024 conference next week.

author: Nestor Corrales
title: US approves sale of training choppers to PH
text:
ADDED ASSET The Philippine military plans to procure at least 10 TH-73A helicopters from the United States (one photographed here on Aug. 6, 2021, in Milton, Florida), according to Manila’s top envoy to Washington. —US Navy photo
MANILA, Philippines — After approving the sale of 20 F-16 fighter jets to the Philippines, the US Department of State has approved the sale of an unspecified number of training helicopters to Manila worth $120 million, which could be an added boost to the military’s assets in the face of growing tensions in the region.
In a statement on Wednesday, the US Defense Security Cooperation Agency (DSCA) said the approval came after the Philippines requested to buy from the US TH-73A training helicopters.
Article continues after this advertisement The DSCA and Manila have not disclosed how many helicopters the Armed Forces of the Philippines wanted to acquire.
A US state department officer informed the Inquirer in an email that the government is considering buying “up to six” training helicopters. Manila’s envoy to Washington, Ambassador Jose Manuel Romualdez, told the Inquirer that the plan was to procure “at least 10” of them.
READ: US approves sale of 20 F-16 fighter jets worth $5.5 billion to PH
The AFP had also requested to purchase aircraft simulators, spare engines, pack-up kits, fuel tanks, aircraft hoists and lifts, commercial avionics, and commercial flight management systems.
The DSCA said Congress had been notified of the approval of the possible Foreign Military Sales (FMS) of training helicopters to the Philippines, the United States’ oldest treaty and military ally in the region.
Article continues after this advertisement Funding options Under the US FMS, a country “may purchase or receive US-made defense articles and services either with their own funds or with funds provided through US government-sponsored assistance programs.”
In certain cases, defense equipment may be obtained through grants or leases, according to the DSCA.
Article continues after this advertisement It said that the principal contractor of the training helicopters would be the AgustaWestland Philadelphia Corporation in Philadelphia (Leonardo).
The proposed sale followed two weeks after the US approved the sale of F-16 aircraft to the Philippines for an estimated cost of $5.58 billion (or P319 billion).
It also came after US Secretary of Defense Pete Hegseth visit to the Philippines on March 28, where he renewed Washington’s “ironclad commitment” to Manila’s defense.
The DSCA said the proposed sale would support the foreign policy and national security of the United States by “helping to improve the security of a strategic partner that continues to be an important force for political stability, peace, and economic progress in Southeast Asia.”
Beijing, which has a long-standing maritime dispute with Manila over the West Philippine Sea, has warned the Philippines against threatening “regional peace” after the United States approved the sale of F-16 fighter jets.
Procurement plan “The Philippines’ defense and security cooperation with other countries should not target any third party or harm the interests of a third party. Nor should it threaten regional peace and security or exacerbate regional tensions,” Chinese foreign ministry spokesperson Guo Jiakun said earlier this month.
Earlier, AFP chief Gen. Romeo Brawner Jr. said the military would procure more assets for the military, including missile systems, warships, and multi-role fighter jets, “to build a strong and reliable deterrent force.”
In 2024, President Marcos approved the military’s revised wish list for its “Re-Horizon 3,” the last stage in the AFP modernization program.
The new procurement plan would have a timeline of 10 years and is expected to cost about P2 trillion.
Your subscription could not be saved. Please try again.

author: NewsBreak Original
title: The warmest December in Newton County history
text: The popular image of an idyllic December is one of white Christmases, hot chocolate retreats, snow-capped conifers, and cozy, cold-weather activities. But not every December lives up to those expectations. Most of the continental U.S. will experience its peak winter cold weather in January and February . Officially, winter doesn't even start until Dec. 21. Across the U.S., the average December temperature from 1901-2000 was right above freezing point, at 32.68 F. Yearly temperatures can be compared to this 20th-century long-term average to find how uncommon a year's December climate was. The nation's warmest December on record was 2021, when the average temperature reached 6.66 F above the long-term average, at 39.34 F. December 2022 was closer to the previous century's average for the U.S. overall, at 33.08 F. The average temperature in Newton County, Mississippi from 1901-2000 was 46.8. The diverse climates of the U.S. mean residents can experience a range of holiday weather without breaking out their passports. Within the continental U.S., Monroe County, Florida, at the Southeast tip of the state, reported the highest average December temperature during the past century at 67.6 F. On the other end of the spectrum was Roseau County, Minnesota, bordering Canada, at 7.2 F. However, across both sides of the extremes, temperatures are warming. While that doesn't mean every December will be warmer than the last or the prior century's average, it does mean long-term temperature averages will continue to inch up the thermometer. When did Newton County, Mississippi experience its warmest December? To find out, Stacker used data from the National Centers for Environmental Information to identify the 15 Decembers with the highest average temperature since 1895. Also included is how that year's temperature compared to the 1901-2000 average. Read on to see if you lived through the warmest December in Newton County, Mississippi history.
